snippet: Much else in the old neighborhood has disappeared, but for a few hours on Sunday mornings, stickball teams still compete in East Harlem.
abstract: Four stickball teams compete in the East Harlem League on East 109th Street; game has been played in the neighborhood for more than 70 years, and decades-worth of photos and memorabilia attest to the game's local history at the Stickball Community Gallery on East 123rd Street.
lead_paragraph: Much else in the old neighborhood has disappeared, but for a few hours on Sunday mornings, stickball teams still compete in East Harlem.

headline.seo: They’re Still Swinging for the Rooftops in East Harlem
headline.main: They’re Still Swinging for the Rooftops in East Harlem
headline.print_headline: They’re Still Swinging for the Rooftops in East Harlem
